Dating: 25TH DYNASTY AND CONTEMPORARIES (not before); 26TH DYNASTY (not after)
Name: Block statue of Ankh-Takelot
Description: This block statue of a man in a garment that covers his entire body is almost completely preserved. The arms are crossed on the knees and in his right hand the man is holding a folded cloth. He is wearing a striated wig and has a very flat, broad skull. The base and the body of the man are covered in inscriptions. On the front of the statue, a figure of Osiris has been carved in the stone in raised relief. He is facing right and holding the crook (heqa-sceptre) and flagellum (nekhakha-sceptre) in his hands.
